help_faq_q_one_title: How do I list or upload my products on tradeling.com?
help_faq_q_one_answer: Please log in to your registered Seller account on Tradeling. Click on "My Account". Then go to <link>"Product Catalogue"</link> on the left side of the page, upload your product images first in the Media Bank and then click on "Upload Product".
help_faq_q_one_answer_desc: For more details, click <link>here</link> and follow the instructions under section 3 "Step-by-step on how to upload your items, Part 1: Upload new products in bulk."
help_faq_q_two_title: How do I upload images of my products?
help_faq_q_two_answer: Please log in to your registered Seller's account on Tradeling. Click on "My Account". Then go to <link>"Product Catalogue"</link> on the left side of the page, upload your product images first in the <link1>"Media Bank"</link1>. Upload photos, before uploading the template to automatically add/sync the photos to a particular item. A maximum of 10 photos can be uploaded per product. To name multiple pictures of the same product you must use the SKU or barcode followed by underscore [_] and followed by sequential numbers.
help_faq_q_two_answer_desc: For more details, kindly click <link>here</link> and refer to section 3, "Step-by-step on how to upload your items, Part 1: a. Bulk media & photo upload." You can also review the images guidelines in section 1 of the same page.
help_faq_q_three_title: How do I update existing products?
help_faq_q_three_answer: Please log in to your registered Seller account on Tradeling. Click on "My Account". Then go to <link>"Product Catalogue"</link> on the left side of the page, upload your product images first in the Media Bank and then click on "Upload Product".
help_faq_q_three_answer_desc: For more details, click <link>here</link> and follow the instructions under section 3 "Step-by-step on how to upload your items, Part 1: Upload new products in bulk."

shipping_preferences_international_shipp: Opt in and out of delivery methods you are willing to provide for orders purchased outside the UAE.
Ex Works allows the buyer to collect their goods from your chosen location. It is our default delivery method that all sellers must agree to.
As the seller I am happy to pay for transportation of the goods to the port of shipment, plus loading costs.
Please select your preferred Port of Origin, the port you are willing to ship from.
I will arrange for the carriage of goods by sea to a port of destination and provide the buyer with the documents necessary to obtain them from the carrier.
I will cover all the costs of transport (export fees, carriage, insurance, and destination port charges) and assume all risk until the goods are unloaded at the terminal.
shipping_preferences_domestic_shipping_c: Opt in and out of delivery methods you are willing to provide for orders purchased in the UAE.
shipping_preferences_domestic_shipping_l: Domestic buyers can collect their goods from a location of my choice.

txt_error_file_size_should_be_less_than_: File size should be less than 10Mb
txt_error_while_processing_your_request: There was an error while processing your request.',
sm_seller_help: Seller delivers to Buyer stated address.
sm_buyer_help: Buyer picks up from Seller stated address.
sm_buyer_alert: Please arrange for the shipping by contacting the seller directly or contacting our support team.
sm_exw_help: Buyer collects goods from Seller stated address.
sm_exw_tooltip: The Buyer is responsible to collect the goods from the seller’s premises (warehouse or factory), clear the goods for export and bear all shipping costs and risks.
sm_fob_help: Seller delivers to port of shipment.
sm_fob_tooltip: The Seller clears the goods for export and they are considered delivered once on board the vessel at the named port of shipment. The Buyer assumes all risks and costs for goods from this moment forward.
sm_cif_help: Seller delivers to port of destination.
sm_cif_alert: Your Order will be delivered to your shipping address.
sm_cif_tooltip: The Seller clears the goods for export and delivers them when they are on board the vessel at the port of shipment. The Seller bears the cost of freight and insurance to the named port of destination. The seller is required to purchase the minimum level of insurance. The Buyer is responsible for all costs associated with unloading the goods at the named port of destination and clearing goods for import. Risk passes from seller to buyer once the goods are on board the vessel at the port of shipment.
sm_dap_tooltip: REFERRED TO AS DDP (DUTY DELIVERED PAID). The seller assumes all charges and risks of operations including export procedures, transportation, customs duty, taxes and final delivery in the country/ destination without unloading.
address_book_address_is_used_modal_title: You can not delete this address

upload_document_form_message: We need to verify your business and need the following documents to do so. Getting verified gives you access to all Tradeling features. If you do not have these documents at the moment, you can upload these at a later time under "Account profile".
upload_document_form_trade_license_descr: Upload a copy of your Trade Licence. This lets us verify you as an official business. This can be a PDF, JPEG, TIF.
upload_document_form_trade_license_expir: Trade License Expiry date. We’ll contact you when it needs renewed
upload_document_form_identity_document_d: Your Emirates ID lets us verify your Trade Licence. We need this to confirm you are a representative of the business. Please upload the front and back of your Emirates ID. ALternatively you can upload a copy of your passport ID page and visa.
upload_document_form_identity_document_e: Emirates ID number expiry date. We’ll contact you when it needs renewed.
upload_document_form_vat_certificate_des: Your VAT Certificate contains information needed for Tradeling to provide you with invoices. Upload a copy of your VAT Certificate.
upload_document_form_vat_certificate_not: My business is not eligible for a VAT Certificate
If your business is not eligible for a VAT Certificate you must provide a Letter of Exemption instead
upload_document_form_terms_conditions_te: I agree to the {terms} presented by Tradeling including the {commissionStructure} and the {payoutProcess}

pending_verification_modal_subtitle: This means there’s certain features you won’t be able to interact with for the next 48 hours while we verify your documents. We’ll send you an email to let you know when you’re all set up!
